text:
e="preserve">Sam Bobrick (July 24, 1932 – October 11, 2019) was an American author, playwright, television writer, and lyricist. He was born in Chicago. Bobrick was known for creating the television series "Saved by the Bell". He also worked on writing the screenplay for television shows like "Gomer Pyle, U.S.M.C." and "The Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour".
Bobrick died on October 11, 2019 of a stroke in Northridge, California, aged 87.
